snippet: Aaron Vansintjan, visiting for Christmas with his family, was climbing a hill to the Cloisters when the police got suspicious.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on Dec 22, 2011, wrongful arrest of Belgian tourist Aaron Vansintjan; the 21-year-old was on his way to meet friends in Upper Manhattan when he was arrested at gunpoint and held for several hours, accused of a local burglary; Vansintjan, who was eventually released, was never told that while he was being interrogated, the man who reported the burglary told police he had made up the story.
lead_paragraph: Aaron Vansintjan, visiting for Christmas with his family, was climbing a hill to the Cloisters when the police got suspicious.

headline.seo: Belgian Tourist Arrested, but Crime Never Happened
headline.main: An Arrest for a Crime That, It Turned Out, Never Happened
headline.print_headline: An Arrest for a Crime That, It Turned Out, Never Happened
